div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 22:53 pm CDT

div.div: A 30 percent chance of showers and thunderstorms, mainly before midnight. Partly cloudy, with a low around 36. Northeast wind around 5 mph becoming calm.
Sunny, with a high near 66. Breezy, with a northwest wind 5 to 10 mph increasing to 15 to 20 mph in the afternoon. Winds could gust as high as 30 mph.
Mostly clear, with a low around 35. North northwest wind 10 to 15 mph becoming light north after midnight. Winds could gust as high as 20 mph.

div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 22:53 pm CDT

div.div: A 30 percent chance of showers and thunderstorms, mainly before midnight. Partly cloudy, with a low around 36. Northeast wind around 5 mph becoming calm.
Sunny, with a high near 66. Breezy, with a northwest wind 5 to 10 mph increasing to 15 to 20 mph in the afternoon. Winds could gust as high as 30 mph.
Mostly clear, with a low around 35. North northwest wind 10 to 15 mph becoming light north after midnight. Winds could gust as high as 20 mph.

h3.a: April 2020 Staff Person Of The Month

b.span: North Platte Public Schools Awards Staff Member of the Month for April

span.span: The North Platte Public Schools Foundation in conjunction with North Platte Public Schools is excited to announce that we are honoring Taryn Oliver as the NPPS Bulldog Staff member of the month for April.

Miss Oliver is the Physical Education teacher at Lincoln Elementary. Oliver, a graduate of University of Nebraska Kearney, started her career at North Platte Public Schools in 2014. She taught high school health education before moving to a PE classroom. She is a member of the Lincoln PBIS team. Last fall she organized a Harry Potter book club for 40 students after school.

Her principal, Matt Irish, nominated Miss Oliver. “Taryn is relentlessly finding ways to help our students and staff be successful. She has been instrumental in developing a wet/cold weather indoor recess plan to help the students get the exercise and social interactions they need.” Said Irish. “Taryn brings an excitement and love of learning to Lincoln Elementary.” He said.

The April business sponsor was Next Nebraska. Monthly Sponsors give honorees a gift basket. The Foundation provides balloons and a gift card to the Bulldog Store at NPHS, and Prairie Friends and Flowers delivers a bouquet.

The North Platte Public Schools Foundation facilitates the program and takes nominations from principals and administration. Staff members are awarded monthly throughout the school year and will be recognized at Education After Hours.
Interested business sponsors can contact the North Platte Public Schools Foundation at 696-3325.

a.aria-label: Read more about April 2020 Staff Person Of The Month

h3.a: NPPSD – Board of Education Passes Elementary Merger

span.span: NPPSD – Board of Education Passes Elementary Merger

North Platte, Neb. – Monday, April 13, 2020, the North Platte Public School District Board of Education (BOE) passed a very exciting merger that will improve efficiencies across the district. Tonight a task force, formed in January, presented a proposal that would merge Buffalo and Lincoln Elementaries.

During the April BOE meeting, the task force made its final proposal to the NPPSD Board of Education for approval. This proposal included benefits of the merger that address the addition of a full-time counselor and the development of a three-track elementary school. A three-track system at Lincoln Elementary will allow for smaller class sizes, resulting in a more even distribution of the number of students, students with special needs, and students with behavioral issues throughout each grade level (aligning to the district goal of K-2 (20-22) & 3-5 (22-24) – district average). Additionally, this merger will allow Buffalo Elementary to become a premier site for pre-school in the district, which includes two Head Start classrooms. This proposal outlined efficiencies in building/ classroom utilization, no need for transportation to and from each building, and administrative support.

The newly approved merger has given the district the opportunity to consolidate and re-align pre-school and elementary classes across the district. The following options will be offered at each school.
Buffalo - Pre-K Site
Preschool- 3 full-day - 4-year-old options
2 Head Start Classrooms
Lincoln - K-5
Lincoln full-day preschool will move to Buffalo
Bulldog Behavior Success Program will move to Cody
Cody - K-5
Bulldog Behavior Success Program
Preschool - am/pm half-day 4-year-old options - will be moved to Osgood Elementary
Osgood - PK-1
Preschool - am/pm half-day 3-year-old (pending NDE Early Childhood Expansion Grant)
Preschool - am/pm half-day 4-year-old options (from Cody)
2nd grade - will be moved to Lake Elementary
Ladybug Crossing Daycare (LBC) will be located here - for more information about LBC email:

li.a: ladybugcrossingcc@gmail.com

span.span: Lake - 2-5
Jefferson - PK-5
Preschool - am/pm half-day 4-year-old option
Washington - PK-5
Preschool - 1 full-day 4-year old option
McDonald - K-5
Eisenhower - K-5

Starting later this week, preschool parents who have already registered will be called and given the option to stay enrolled in the current session assigned or choose another section based on revised locations within the district.
Additional information about the vote or BOE meeting can be found at (this may not be available immediately)
https://www.nppsd.org/vnews/display.v/SEC/Board%20of%20Education

a.aria-label: Read more about NPPSD – Board of Education Passes Elementary Merger

div.p: I LOVE being the bearer of great news!! We have received permission from our licensing company to live stream our performance of West Side Story!!!! Mr. Willey took a great video at our last rehearsal (thank goodness!) and has spent hours putting together an amazing video for us to live stream! It has been a heartbreaking month for so many reasons, but this is truly a bright spot!! These kids (especially our seniors!) deserve to be celebrated... and man are they talented!! So, we would love for you to check out the specifics of the live stream below and schedule a family night around the TV! (And I would love for you to send me pictures of your families watching as I am trying my best to document this whole experience for the kids!)
After everything we've all been through in the last month, I think we ALL deserve a night "out" at the "theater"!!!!
If you have any questions, just let me know!
INFORMATION ABOUT THE LIVE STREAM
1. Live stream will be available April 27-May 3rd through a password protected link.
2. Already bought tickets AND provided your email when you purchased? The link and password will be emailed to you on April 26th!
3. Already bought tickets but didn't provide your email? Send an email to lpurdy@nppsd.org to be added to the distribution list!

4. Didn't purchase tickets ahead of time? Go to www.showtix4u.com and search North Platte High School to click on the link for West Side Story Livestream tickets. Just $12 will buy a ticket for your household, and you will then receive the link and password! Not only will it be a great night at the "theater," but it will help us to financially stay afloat so that we can provide another fantastic show next year....in person!
Thank you so much for your support!!
Leah Purdy
Director of Choirs
North Platte High School

a.aria-label: Read more about Update On West Side Story

div.p: NPPS Students & Parents,

We have recently added an additional link called : Student and Parent Technology Support Resources on the NPPS district website under Remote Learning Resources.
Included with this information is the phone number of a Technology Helpline for our students & parents.

Student and Parent Technology Support Resources
https://docs.google.com/document/d/10LaFFVxEuPhb-tcf9FMK--3FSFWUErX4455j2WcMb5Y/edit?usp=sharing

If your student is having difficulty accessing remote learning resources you can call for assistance on the technology helpline at (308)535-6060. Technology assistants will assist you in resolving technical issues you are experiencing while accessing remote learning resources.
The helpline will be staffed from 8am - 4pm Monday through Friday (excluding holidays). Again, the phone number for student and parent technology assistance is (308)535-6060.
NPPS staff members will continue to use current procedures in place for submitting for technical assistance through the helpdesk system.
Thank You

a.aria-label: Read more about Student & Parent Tech Help Line

p.b: Support with children's behavioral health needs

The National Suicide Prevention Lifeline is a national network of local crisis centers that provides free and confidential emotional support to people in suicidal crisis or emotional distress 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. We're committed to improving crisis services and advancing suicide prevention by empowering individuals, advancing professional best practices, and building awareness.
Mental Health First Aid for Veterans & their families
​Help at the End of the Line
The Boys Town National Hotline is open 24 hours a day, 365 days a year, and is staffed by specially trained Boys Town counselors. It is accredited by the American Association of Suicidology (AAS).

Spanish-speaking counselors and translation services for more than 100 languages also are available 24 hours a day. The speech- and hearing-impaired can contact us at our email address: hotline@boystown.org.

The Child Mind Institute is an independent, national nonprofit dedicated to transforming the lives of children and families struggling with mental health and learning disorders. Our teams work every day to deliver the highest standards of care, advance the science of the developing brain and empower parents, professionals, and policymakers to support children when and where they need it most.

a.aria-label: Read more about Mental Wellness During a Pandemic

h3.a: North Platte Public School District Food & Nutrition Services Programs

div.p: North Platte Public School District Food & Nutrition Services Programs

p.strong:
UPDATE REGARDING MEAL PICK-UP
BEGINNING THE WEEK OF APRIL 6, 2020

div.p: Drive Through Breakfast & Lunch Pickup
NPPSD is providing pre-packed breakfast and lunch to children 18 years old and younger.

Drive Through Location Madison Middle School
1400 N Madison Ave, North Platte, NE 69101

Guidelines
1. Breakfast and lunch will be provided in pre-packaged bags for all community children ages 18
and younger Monday through Thursday until further notice.
2. Thursday pick-up, you have the option to receive breakfast and lunch meals for
Thursday and also meals for Friday, Saturday, and Sunday. All meals are at no charge.
3. Pick-up times are from 9:30 a.m. – 12:30 p.m.
4. Children must be in the vehicle to receive their bags of food.
5. Enter from Jackson Avenue which is on the west side of Madison, through the alley, proceed
to the loading dock, stop and pick-up bags, exit to 14th street.
6. Please do not park and get out of your vehicle.
7. Please do not congregate or consume meals on-site.
Programas de servicios de alimentación y nutrición del distrito escolar público de North Platte

p.strong:
ACTUALIZACIÓN SOBRE LA RECOGIDA DE COMIDA
COMIENZO LA SEMANA DEL 6 DE ABRIL DE 2020

div.p: Conduzca a través del desayuno y el almuerzo.
NPPSD ofrece desayuno y almuerzo preenvasados a niños de 18 años o menos.

Conduzca por el lugar Madison Middle School
1400 N Madison Ave, North Platte, NE 69101

Pautas
1. El desayuno y el almuerzo se proporcionarán en bolsas preempaquetadas para todos los niños de la comunidad de 18 años.
y más jóvenes de lunes a jueves hasta nuevo aviso.
2) Recogida el jueves, tiene la opción de recibir desayunos y almuerzos para
Jueves y también comidas para viernes, sábado y domingo. Todas las comidas son sin cargo.
3. Los horarios de recogida son de 9:30 a.m. a 12:30 p.m.
4. Los niños deben estar en el vehículo para recibir sus bolsas de comida.
5. Ingrese desde Jackson Avenue, que está en el lado oeste de Madison, a través del callejón, continúe
al muelle de carga, pare y recoja bolsas, salga a la calle 14.
6. Por favor, no se estacione y salga de su vehículo.
7. No se congregue ni consuma comidas en el lugar.

span.span: NPPSD is providing free pre-packed food packs to NPPSD children 18 years old and younger.
Every-Other Friday beginning, April 3, 2020, until further notice
Drive Through Location McKinley Education Center
301 West F Street, North Platte, NE 69101
Packs will be provided in pre-packaged bags for all district children ages 18 and younger every-other Friday until further notice.
Enter from F street and circle in front of the McKinley Education Center. Stop at the designated area, pick up your pack, then exit by turning left on Sycamore.
Please do not park and/ or get out of your vehicle.
Please do not
congregate or consume meals on-site.
The distribution will be from 8:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. Every - Other Friday beginning April 3, 2020
